arts.ttl: Fulham condemn 10-man Wolves to eighth defeat of season
arts.sum: Wolves' season continues to spiral after Fulham condemn them to another damaging defeat to keep them winless and bottom of the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Sessegnon steers Fulham to win over woeful Wolves
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers must be sick of the sight of Ryan Sessegnon. The Roehampton raider has scored more Premier League goals against Wolves than anyone else and he followed up a stunning strike at Molineux last season with a goal inside ten minutes at Craven Cottage before Marco Silva’s side eased to a comfortable victory at […]

arts.ttl: "We should be embarrassed" - Wolves goalkeeper candid after Fulham defeat
arts.sum: It's difficult in the Premier League to have a man down and try to get a result. We've got good players and just need to turn it around quickly.

arts.ttl: Mark Clattenburg shares what VAR should have done with Emmanuel Agbadou's red card vs Fulham
arts.sum: Emmanuel Agbadou’s red card against Fulham took the game out of reach for Wolves, but Mark Clattenburg says a mistake was made by VAR. Mark Clattenburg says VAR made a mistake with Emmanuel Agbadou

arts.ttl: Woeful Wolves beaten as Fulham end losing streak
arts.sum: Silva's men rally as Sessegnon, Wilson and an own goal earn them a 3-0 win at the Cottage

arts.ttl: Pereira's Wolves woes continue as Silva's Fulham dominate 10-man Old Gold
arts.sum: Fulham put on a dominant display in a 3-0 against 10-man Wolverhampton Wanderers at Craven Cottage on Saturday, leaving Wolves still without a Premier League win.

arts.ttl: Fulham cruise past Wolves to end losing run and turn up heat on Vítor Pereira
arts.sum: The wait goes on and on for Vítor Pereira and Wolves. Not since 26 April – 189 days to be precise – have the beleaguered Portuguese manager and his team tasted victory in the Premier League and that never looked like changing on yet another afternoon when nothing seemed to go their way. From the moment Ryan Sessegnon put Fulham ahead in the ninth minute, there was little prospect of Marco Silva’s side not going on to end their run of four straight defeats – especially when Emmanuel Agbadou was sent off towards the end of the first half. Harry Wilson and a disastrous own goal from substitute Yerson Mosquera made sure of the points after the break to leave Pereira sweating over his future. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Vítor Pereira future in doubt after Fulham ease to victory over Wolves
arts.sum: Strikes from Ryan Sessegnon and Harry Wilson, as well as Yerson Mosquera’s own goal, kept Wanderers rooted to the foot of the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Fulham vs Wolverhampton Wanderers: Premier League Preview, Gameweek 10, 2025/26
arts.sum: Throughout the 4-3 defeat to Chelsea, two Wolves players picked up knocks that could see them ruled out of action for the Fulham match. The duo of Matt Doherty and Rodrigo Gomes will likely be forced to sit this one out, with the severity of their injuries being unknown at this current time.

arts.ttl: Fulham vs Wolverhampton Wanderers - Preview: Premier League, 2025/26
arts.sum: Throughout the 4-3 defeat to Chelsea, two Wolves players picked up knocks that could see them ruled out of action for the Fulham match. Fulham have been one of the most heavily impacted teams so far this season, but this looks set to change.
